data.title: Reacting to Celebrity Skincare Routines: Christina Milian’s Routine 🌟 #selfcareseries Finding that precious ‘me-time’ can be a real...
data.meta_description:
255 likes, 20 comments - aveseena on May 31, 2024: "Reacting to Celebrity Skincare Routines: Christina Milian’s Routine 🌟 #selfcareseries

Finding that precious ‘me-time’ can be a real challenge, but we all know how comforting our nighttime routines can be. Today, I’m diving into Christina Milian’s skincare routine, and while it’s mostly fab, due to time constraints, I’ll focus on 2 major no-nos! 🚫

1. Makeup Wipes: 🚫
These aren’t gentle enough for regular use, especially for sensitive skin. 
➡️They don’t effectively remove all makeup remnants and can tug at your skin, leading to irritation and premature aging (aka signs of #inflammaging). 
⭐️Instead, opt for a gel cleanser or a balm/oil-based cleanser suited to your skin type. 🚿✨ 
⛔️Makeup wipes are a NO in my book for good cleansing.

2. Sugar Scrub: 🚫
This is a big no-no, much like the infamous walnut or apricot scrubs. 
➡️ The rough texture of sugar can damage your skin barrier and cause more problems down the road, like irritation and sensitivities. 😱I made the mistake of using it as a teenager, and trust me, the aftermath was not pretty. 
💚Instead, choose a soft exfoliator tailored to your skin type. 🧖‍♀️🌸 
⛔️So sugar scrubs (or walnut or apricot scrubs) are another BIG NO in my book. 
⭐️Use gentle exfoliants suitable to your skin type.

You can find the original video for Christina Milian on @HarpersBazaar! 🌿✨

#SkincareTips #ChristinaMilian #NighttimeRoutine #SkincareNoNos #BusyMums #HealthySkin #DrEbruexplains #inflammaging #aveseena #skincareroutine #sugarscrub #harpersbazaargotobedwithme".
